Package controller

Class RPGController

java.lang.Object
controller.RPGController
public class RPGController
extends Object
This class represents the controller for the game. It provides various methods that the view can use to get and set information about the game
Author:
Adi, Joesph, Shane, Dillion

  • Constructor Details

    • RPGController

      public RPGController​(Observer view)
      Creates an instance of the controller
      Parameters:
      view - The view that should observe the model

  • Method Details

    • selectUnit

      public boolean selectUnit​(int col, int row)
      Checks if the given tile can be selected by whoever's turn it is
      Parameters:
      col - The column index of the tile
      row - The row index of the tile
      Returns:
      true if th current tile can be selected

    • getPlayerGold

      public int getPlayerGold()
      Get the player's gold amount
      Returns:
      The amount of gold the player has

    • getAIGold

      public int getAIGold()
      Get the AI's gold amount
      Returns:
      The amount of gold the AI has

    • buildCity

      public void buildCity​(int col, int row)
      Builds a city on the tile at the given coordinates. Make sure the city can be built before this is called.
      Parameters:
      col - The column index of the tile
      row - The row index of the tile

    • canBuildCity

      public boolean canBuildCity​(int col, int row)
      Checks if a city can be built by whoever's turn it is on the given tile
      Parameters:
      col - The column index of the tile
      row - The row index of the tile
      Returns:
      true if a city can be built and false otherwise

    • canAddUnit

      public boolean canAddUnit​(int col, int row)
      Checks if a unit can be added by whoever's turn it is on the given tile
      Parameters:
      col - The column index of the tile
      row - The row index of the tile
      Returns:
      true if it can be added and false otherwise

    • addUnit

      public boolean addUnit​(int col, int row, String type)
      Adds a unit of the specified type at the specified index. Make sure to check that a unit can be added before calling this
      Parameters:
      col - The column index of the tile
      row - The row index of the tile
      type - The type of unit to build. "settler", "foot_soilder", or "archer".
      Returns:
      true if the unit was added and false otherwise

    • moveUnit

      public boolean moveUnit​(int fromCol, int fromRow, int toCol, int toRow)
      Moves a unit from one tile to another
      Parameters:
      fromCol - The current column index
      fromRow - The current row index
      toCol - The column index to move to
      toRow - The row index to move to
      Returns:
      true if the unit moved and false otherwise

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      Ends the turn for the nation, and calls the other nation to take their turn

    • takeTurn

      public void takeTurn()
      If the nation is not AI controlled, does nothing If the nation is AI controlled, will first check: 1. If there is other unit to attack 2. If can settle city 3. If can build anything 4. Move random piece 5. Skip turn If any of the above are true, performs that action for that turn, and then returns.

    • isGameOver

      private boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over. The game is over when either the AI or the player has no units left.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over and false otherwise

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Creates a new game

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile​(int col, int row)
      Gets the tile at the given index
      Parameters:
      col - The column index
      row - The row index
      Returns:
      The tile

    • updateView

      public void updateView()
      Asks the model to update the view
